column4: I'm trying to switch my Gforce video card for a radeon (using regular radeon driver), but i can't get the geforce driver to stop loading so there is an error every time I boot
I'm trying to switch my Gforce video card for a radeon (using regular radeon driver), but i can't get the geforce driver to stop loading so there is an error every time I boot
someone please tell me how to stop my old geforce drivers to stop loading
because i'm trying to use a radeon now
I'm trying to switch my Gforce video card for a radeon (using regular radeon driver), but i can't get the geforce driver to stop loading so there is an error every time I boot
have you tried blacklisting the driver?
I'm trying to switch my Gforce video card for a radeon (using regular radeon driver), but i can't get the geforce driver to stop loading so there is an error every time I boot
have you tried blacklisting the driver? or am I misunderstanding your problem?
i used to have a geforce and i switched my card.. but the geforce driver keeps loading so ubuntu won't load any other drivers
are we on the same page then? what's blacklisting
blacklisting is simply stopping a driver from starting up on boot.. I'm not sure if it would help or not
there is a script file somewhere to do it, but I can't remember the directory..
oh ok
maybe someone else can help me
it seems like it would be simple
all i'm doing is changing my video cards
i don't see why ubuntu is doing this
I'm trying to switch my Gforce video card for a radeon (using regular radeon driver), but i can't get the geforce driver to stop loading so there is an error every time I boot
and i can't try to run any other drivers
please help, this is annoying
This is all I could find, maybe it's a start anyway. the blacklist directory is in /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist
